quotes.quote: Error often is to be preferred to indecision.
Indecision becomes decision with time.
Indecision, doubt and fear. The members of this unholy trio are closely related; where one is found, the other two are close at hand.
Worry is a sustained form of fear caused by indecision.
Patience is decisive indecision.
Through indecision opportunity is often lost.
Greatness is never achieved through indecision.
Nothing is so exhausting as indecision, and nothing is so futile.
The risk of a wrong decision is preferable to the terror of indecision.
Be decisive. A wrong decision is generally less disastrous than indecision.
The worst of all human ailments: indecision.
Indecision is a major time waster; 80% of decisions should be made the first time they come up.
The worst decision is indecision.
Indecision is fatal. It is better to make a wrong decision than build up a habit of indecision. If you're wallowing in indecision, you certainty can't act - and action is the basis of success.
Always remember, indecision is decision - usually against you.
He who hesitates is sometimes saved.
Indecision is a form of self-abuse - be ready to step up!
Indecision with the passing of time becomes decision.
Indecision is the greatest thief of opportunity.
Indecision is actually the individual's decision to fail.
Things can harden meaningfully in the moment of indecision.
To be constantly changing one's plans isn't decision at all-it's indecision.
One of the painful things about our time is that those who feel certainty are stupid, and those with any imagination and understanding are filled with doubt and indecision.
Some live in a state of passionate indecision.
What is fear after all? It is indecision. You seek some way to resist, escape. There is none.
Opportunity never sneaks up on those who straddle the fence of indecision.
Indecision is debilitating; it feeds upon itself; it is, one might almost say, habit-forming. Not only that, but it is contagious; it transmits itself to others.
Indecision is the seedling of fear.
Indecision may or may not be our biggest problem.
Indecisiveness wears a person out.
Indecision and delays are the parents of failure.
Indecision is a virus that can run through an army and destroy its will to win or even to survive.
Endurance is frequently a form of indecision.
More is lost by indecision than wrong decision. Indecision is the thief of opportunity. It will steal you blind.
Beige is the color of indecision.
More errors arise from inhibited indecision than from impulsive behavior.
Inaction and indecision in the present is because of fear of consequences of the future.
Indecision is the seedling of fear
Indecision is the key to flexibility.
There is no more miserable human being than one in whom nothing is habitual but indecision.
Now, the melancholy god protects thee, and the tailor make that doublet of changeable taffeta, for thy mind is a very opal.
Then, indecision brings its own delays, / And days are lost lamenting o'er lost days.
I must have a prodigious quantity of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up.
The tragedy of a man who could not make up his mind.
I'll give you a definite maybe.
A wrong decision isn't forever; it can always be reversed. The losses from a delayed decision are forever; they can never be retrieved.
The archbishop is usually to be found nailing his colours to the fence.
While there is nothing inherently wrong with asking questions, the inability to decide on correct answers can make us unhappy.
Indecision is fatal, so make up your mind.
Indecisive as a fellow who pulls back one leg as he moves forward with the other.
How long halt ye between two opinions?
Decision is a sharp knife that cuts clean and straight; indecision, a dull one that hacks and tears and leaves ragged edges behind it.
A firm belief attracts facts. They come out in holes in the ground an' cracks in the' wall to support belief, but they run away from doubt.
When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.
When it comes to betting on yourself...you're a chicken-livered coward if you hesitate.
To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
To teach how to live with uncertainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy in our age can still do for those who study it.

Fear comes from uncertainty. When we are absolutely certain, whether, of our worth or worthlessness, we are almost impervious to fear. Thus, a feeling of utter unworthiness can be a source of courage.
Indecision may or may not be my problem.

Indecision may come from an instinctive hunch that there's more you need to know - which means it's time to learn everything you can about the pros and cons of each option. You can continue on this track, however, only as long as you're unearthing genuinely new information.

All around me insisted that my doubts proved only my own ignorance and sinfulness; that they knew by experience they would soon give place to true knowledge and an advance in religion; and I felt something like indecision.

All around me insisted that my doubts proved only my own ignorance and sinfulness; that they knew by experience they would soon give place to true knowledge and an advance in religion; and I felt something like indecision.
Once I make up my mind, I'm full of indecision.
Evil draws its power from indecision and concern for what other people think.
A decision unmade is still a decision. It won't go away. Neither will problems or more options.
I feel like I am in a constant battle with myself. I am being pushed and pulled in two different directions.
Man himself is so buffeted by shifts of thought and mood, not knowing from one day to the next what he truly feels, that a shifting earth is well-nigh the last straw.
Then his heart made up his mind.
The other often much prefer a clear answer, even if it is No than continued indecision and waffling.
Dare to keep moving when it is a must and dare to keep waiting when you have to, but note, you shall always keep waiting if you keep waiting and you shall always keep moving when you keep moving!
Indecision and fear can cripple any chances of succeeding and lead to maelstroms of regret that fuel our most fantastic nightmares.
